title: How to-podcasts Filipino & English
description: Most people lack the basic blockchain knowledge. Before becoming involved in Cardano people need education provided in their native language

f6_assessments.q0:
I strongly agree that it's highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully. 

The proposal plans on a time frame of 3 months, 6 months and one year to produce the targeted 20 podcasts in total. This works out to be about 1 and a half podcasts per month. This looks feasible. They also target 200, 450 and 1k subscribers; and, 1k, 4k and 10k views as their goals. These goals are  hard to gauge and not within their control, but they have solutions to these problems. They will do marketing and promotion and also to ensure some quality in their podcast contents such that the message is well understood by their target audience. 

The proposal team comprises 3 main members each has qualifications, experience and expertise relevant to the project: development management, network marketing, and education. I see these qualities are the prerequisites for the success. 

Budget wise, the costing is mainly on the time resources with clear breakdown by the works (creation, translation, marketing and promotion, narration, script writing and project management) involved in the production of the podcast. A miscellaneous is included, I reckon that this is needed for emergencies or in the event of under budget. I consider these figures acceptable.

f6_assessments.q2:
I strongly agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goal. 

The proposal classifies two sets of KPI's  namely primary and secondary.  The KPIs are the number of podcasts, number of subscription, and number of views. The set targets are within the time frame of 3, 6 and 12 months. 

The primary KPI is 20 podcasts over one year.  The proposers can control the production of videos (podcasts) to ensure the target is met. 

The secondary is not controllable. The team members have to find solutions to uplift the chance of getting to the goals they set. To do that, they will put in a quality assurance in their podcast contents. They ensure the crypto technical terms in the narratives are understood well by newbies by trying out with at least 3 people who are  blockchain / crypto illiterate before they put the videos on air.  They also planned to spend 4 hours a week to do promotion and marketing on various social media.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is the idea of ​​building a Youtube channel (and other media channels) that specializes in the basics of the Cardano blockchain. The podcasts are broadcast regularly every month, the main languages ​​​​are English and Filipino. The purpose is to bring information to the Philippine community in particular and the East Asian community in general. The proposal fully meets the criteria set out by the challenge "Grow East Asia, Grow Cardano".
With content edited by the proposed team, the language of communication close to life will help podcasts attract more views. Thereby helping to improve the knowledge of the Filipino people, attracting more people to propose projects on Catalyst. Also, increase the country's crypto adoption.
I have an extra impactful addition to this proposal which is a report on the popularity of cryptocurrencies in countries around the world. In which, the Philippines only ranked 15th on the chart. Source - Chainalysis
 
https://blog.chainalysis.com/reports/2021-global-crypto-adoption-index/
f6_assessments.q1:
I would agree with the proposal if could add content for podcasts that I think will attract more viewers such as:
+ What is POS?
+ eUTXO mechanism
+ What is DEX?
+ What is a 51% attack?

I think these contents will be more in-depth than the ones proposed. Nowadays, it is easy to come across videos on how to create an ADA wallet, how to buy and sell on Binance when users search on Youtube, an in-depth content but explained in common language will increase the view

Each member of the proposal has years of experience in education and translation. However, how is the knowledge about blockchain technology? I have tried to look closely at the attachments but the answer is still not found.

In addition, the number of subscribers on the Youtube channel or the number of views after a year, the number of interactions or feedback from the community will be a standard measure of the success of the project. I suggest the proposer should add this report at monthly KPI checks.

Besides, I will agree if the proposal can provide more about which social media is used for marketing the project (Twitter, Telegram, Facebook, etc.) These social media all have tools to help you track and measure engagement and response from the community.

f6_assessments.q0: Cardano should not be limited to one language, by translating Cardano into different regional languages would help it gain more popularity and more reach to the users. The proposer has identified the problem effectively and has addressed the solution to it. In order to effectively market or spread the knowledge on Cardano to all the people of the country, translation of the content of Cardona to local language is required and is the most effective way to reach a larger group of people. In this case, the local language would be Filipino, which is very huge community and they are very proud of the language. Hence translating the contents of Cardano in Filipino would reach a lot more people than expected and also be appreciated for translating into Filipino. Most of the people are educated in their local language and might face difficulties in English, by translating the content to Filipino it would benefit a lot of people in getting familiar with Cardano and also the advancements of it. The proposer has effectively addressed the challenge and I strongly believe this application will be a success to Cardano as it will be reach more people and more people will be knowledgeable through this with the comfort of learning in their own language. By doing this it would add a lot of value to the cardona system as it will reach worldwide. The goals of the project are aligned with the challenge. It is also a scalable project and could go global benefiting Cardona on a large scale.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has a roadmap on how to implement the project as they have mentioned the plan for the next working year on how they will be uploading podcasts in Filipino and English language and hence by uploading the Cardona content in the Filipino & English language on a regular interval of time would attract more viewers and gain more subscribers. The proposer has also provided links and their team has the relevant skills and experience to implement the proposal. It would also be helping a lot of people educate about Cardano in a better way. The budget is also clearly mentioned and they have shown the broken down budget and its use cases. This whole together will be indeed bringing a new community to the Cardona, once someone sees the content in Filipino & English they will be more likely to promote the videos on their own to friends and family to watch them and it will be of a better reach. The proposer has a proper plan and will achieve the goal in the projected time and also has pointed out the necessary resources required to complete the project. The experience of proposer and his team seems to be very impressive and the proposal is likely to be implemented successfully. The proposer has foreseen the challenges/risks they might face and also has alternative solutions to solve them.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has requested 11800 USD as funds to implement this project and they have also provided the breakup cost that will be spent on each individual requirement which seems fair. The proposer has also projected the funds for next year and the money requested will be sufficient to audit the progress. The proposal is most likely to succeed as it going to reach over a large community of Thai and English speaking individuals. It will be very useful in reaching Cardona into the market by translating the content into regional languages and the reach will be more than expected in the future days. The proposer has also foreseen the difficulties they might face while implementation and also has alternative solutions for the same. The proposer has understood the problems of the locals clearly and has proposed the suitable solution which will benefit all.

f6_assessments.q1:
Proposer shares enough evidence and relevant skill to implement this proposal if funded, with previous funding in Catalyst,  the team looks experienced and clearly described how many people needed to deliver this proposal in a timely matter. Unfortunately, the team does not share a verifiable link to their profile (they upload narrative credentials, but that was not publicly verified) - although I respect the anonymity or privacy asked, at least the project lead/manager should be shared to share the community.

In terms of budgeting, the proposer shares a detailed breakdown of how it is calculated and is quite reasonably low to mid-range considering the experience and target output.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer presents the milestone and KPIs that can be measured in numbers and it will come from the Youtube analytics, so it's easy to track the progress or achievement. They also mentioned the mitigation/risk management how to achieve these numbers and how to adapt by doing try-outs first before creating the final product/podcasts for future improvement.
